entries.subject: Economics
entries.q: distinguish between sacrificing ratio and gaining ratio
aliases: difference between sacrificing ratio and gaining ratio
entries.a: Meaning: Sacrifice = Old share − New share (admission); Gain = New share − Old share (retirement/death). Effect: Sacrifice reduces future share; Gain increases future share. Use: Basis for goodwill compensation. When: Sacrifice at admission; Gain at retirement/death. Formulae: Sacrificeᵢ = Oldᵢ − Newᵢ; Gainᵢ = Newᵢ − Oldᵢ.

entries.subject: Economics
entries.q: why revalue assets and reassess liabilities at retirement or death
entries.a: To ensure fair settlement for the exiting partner: record current values and unrecorded items so the outgoing partner bears/receives the correct share; transfer net revaluation gain/loss to all partners in old PSR.

entries.subject: Economics
entries.q: why is retiring or deceased partner entitled to share of goodwill
aliases: goodwill entitlement at retirement or death
entries.a: Goodwill is jointly created by all partners; on exit the partner surrenders future benefits arising from goodwill. Therefore, continuing partners (who gain) compensate the outgoing partner for their share of goodwill in the gaining ratio.

entries.subject: Economics
entries.q: methods of computing share of profit for intervening period
aliases: share of profit till date of retirement
profit for the period between last balance sheet and retirement
entries.a: Methods: (i) Last-year profit basis (time apportionment), (ii) Average of past few years’ profit, (iii) Sales-based apportionment. Post via P&L Suspense to outgoing partner; allocate suspense to gaining partners.
